q: PM'' Eric Schmidt is stepping down as CEO of Google and cofounder Larry Page is taking over, the company just announced in its earnings release. Eric Schmidt will become Executive Chairman, focused on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Google's other cofounder, Sergey Brin , will take a more active role in strategic projects including product. He is giving up his role as president. The change is effective starting April 4,

doctor resigns THE British prime minister's director of communications Andy Coulson has resigned amid accusations that he was aware of phone hacking by his journalists while working as editor of the`` News of the World'' newspaper. I can today confirm that I've resigned as Downing Street director of communications, Andy Coulson said in a statement.`` Unfortunately, continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the`` News of the World'' has made it difficult for me to give the 110 per cent

unquestioned intelligence to lead the pioneering technology company.`` We have been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time,'' said Eric Schmidt in announcing the decision. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come.`` Page credited Eric Schmidt with running the company`` brilliantly while keeping the`` headstrong founders'' involved.`` Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him.
